definition: to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
short name for Chahar Province 察哈爾|察哈尔[Cha2 ha1 er3]
to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident

sentences.english: He is a man of keen observation .
sentences.chinese: 他是一个观察力敏锐的人。

sentences.english: We all like to think that we are accurate and observant.
sentences.chinese: 我们都愿意相信我们的正确判断和敏锐观察力。

sentences.english: The selected soldier needed to have keen eyesight, plus the ability to react quickly.
sentences.chinese: 被选的士兵要求有敏锐的观察力及的反应力。

sentences.english: My powers of observation were honed through it.
sentences.chinese: 我的观察力也得到磨砺。

sentences.english: They are extremely curious and observant, and seek new experiences constantly.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常好奇，观察力敏锐，经常寻求新鲜的体验。

sentences.english: CoolHorn compliments that his senses are great even in mist of a conversation.
sentences.chinese: 人妖赞赏躬亲在对话当中还有敏捷的观察力。

sentences.english: Rooster is a very observant person.
sentences.chinese: 属鸡的人观察力非常敏锐。

sentences.english: She is a student of keen observation.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个观察力敏锐的学生。

sentences.english: I admired the fact that they used such great observations and descriptions, but every single one of them took forever to read and were pretty darn boring.
sentences.chinese: 我真佩服他们的观察力和记忆力。

sentences.english: His scientific pursuits had made him a very observant man.
sentences.chinese: 他对科学的追求已使他成为一个观察力敏锐的人。

definition: eyesight/strength of vision/the ability to make discerning judgments
sixth sense (i.e. intuition, premonition, telepathy etc)
